intro: Manglietia duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's manglietia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Colombia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, leathery leaves and produces fragrant, white to pale pink blossoms. It is typically found in shaded, humid environments and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
